intro: Henriettella cuabae, commonly known as the Malagasy hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Henriettella cuabae thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species in the study of Malagasy flora.
